FuncDef:
The save aaa online-fail-record command saves user login failure records to a local file.
By default, no user login failure record is saved to a local file.
CLIs: save aaa online-fail-record { domain-name <domain-name> | slot <slot-number> | username <username> | interface { { <interfacename> | <interfacetype> <interfacenumber> } | { <vlaninterfacename> | <vlaninterfacetype> <vlaninterfacenumber> } { pevlan <pevlan-id> [ cevlan <cevlan-id> ] } } | user-type { bind | admin | none } | mac-address <mac-address> } * [ count <record-count> ] output file <file-name>
save aaa online-fail-record [ time <begin-time> <end-time> [ date <begin-date> <end-date> ] ] output file <file-name>
save aaa online-fail-record { ip-address <ip-address> | ipv6-address <ipv6-address> } [ count <record-count> ] output file <file-name>
save aaa online-fail-record { pevlan <pevlan-id> [ cevlan <cevlan-id> ] } [ count <record-count> ] output file <file-name>

ParaDef.Info:
Saves login failure records of users in a specified domain.
The value is a string of 1 to 64 characters.

Saves login failure records of users on the board in a specified slot.
The value is an integer.

Saves login failure records of the user with a specified name.
The value is a string of 1 to 253 characters.

Saves user login failure records on a specified interface.
-

Specifies the name of the interface through which users go online.
The value is a string case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies the type of the interface through which users go online.
The value is a string case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies the number of the interface through which users go online.
The value is a string case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Saves login failure records of users whose packets carry a specified VLAN ID on an interface. This parameter is valid only for Ethernet interfaces.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4094.

Saves login failure records of users whose packets carry a specified QinQ VLAN ID on an interface. If the value is 0, login failure records of whose packets carry single VLAN tags are saved to a local file.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4094.

Saves login failure records of users of a specified type.
-

Saves login failure records of bind authentication users.
-

Saves login failure records of administrators.
-

Saves login failure records of unauthenticated users.
-

Saves login failure records of the user with a specified MAC address.
The value is in the H-H-H format, where H is a 4-digit hexadecimal number.

Saves a specified number of user login failure records.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 65536.

Specifies a file to store user login failure records.
The value is a character string with the file name extension of .txt. The total length, including the path and file name extension lengths, cannot exceed 64 characters. If no path is specified, user login failure records are saved to cfcard:/aaa_access/ by default.

Saves user login failure records in a specified period of time.
The start times are in the format of HH:MM:SS, standing for hour:minute:second.

Saves user login failure records in a specified period of time.
The end times are in the format of HH:MM:SS, standing for hour:minute:second.

Saves user login failure records in a specified period of dates. If no date is specified, the current date is used.
The start dates are in the format of YYYY/MM/DD, standing for year/month/day.

Saves user login failure records in a specified period of dates. If no date is specified, the current date is used.
The end dates are in the format of YYYY/MM/DD, standing for year/month/day.

Saves login failure records of the user with a specified IPv4 address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Saves login failure records of the user with a specified IPv6 address.
The value is a 32-digit hexadecimal number, in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Examples: <HUAWEI> save aaa online-fail-record domain-name huawei output file online-fail-record.txt
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To save user login failure records during a specified period of time, run the save aaa normal-offline-record [ time  [ date  ] ] output file  command. If no time range is specified, all user login failure records are saved.To save user login failure records based on a single condition or combinations of conditions of domain name, access interface, MAC address, slot ID, user type, and user name, run the save aaa online-fail-record { domain-name  | slot  | username  | interface { {  |  } | {  |  } { pevlan  [ cevlan  ] } } | user-type { bind | admin | none } | mac-address  } * [ count  ] output file  command. You can also specify the number of records to be saved.To save user login failure records based on an outer VLAN ID, run the save aaa online-fail-record { pevlan  [ cevlan  ]} [ count  command. You can also specify the number of records to be saved.To save login failure records based on an IPv4 or IPv6 address, run the save aaa online-fail-record { ip-address  | ipv6-address  } [ count  ] output file  command. You can also specify the number of records to be saved.

Precautions
Only files in the .txt format can be saved.If the sub-reason mapping command is run, the login failure sub-reasons saved are mapped to and displayed as the corresponding general sub-reasons.The file specified cannot have the same name as an existing file.To delete a file on the device, run the delete command.
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
